meanings.definition: A unit of digital information storage equal to 1 trillion bytes.
meanings.sent1: My new computer has a hard drive with several terabytes of storage space.
meanings.sent2: The external hard drive I bought can hold up to two terabytes of data.
meanings.sent3: I never realized how many terabytes of photos I had until I tried to organize them all.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge on the subject was like having terabytes of information at her fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The company's server can store terabytes of data, making it a reliable choice for our needs.

meanings.definition: The amount of digital information that can be stored on a device or system, typically measured in terabytes.
meanings.sent1: The new smartphone boasts a storage capacity of 256 terabytes.
meanings.sent2: When I upgraded my laptop, I made sure it had enough terabytes for all my files.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my brain must have terabytes of useless information stored in it.
meanings.sent4: The library's digital archive contains terabytes of historical documents.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's research project required terabytes of data to be processed accurately.
